column1: NGR is Rug (or Rhug Hall) in what looks like the kitchen garden, which is mentioned on one of the records. Altitudues match at 500 ft but some records have 600 ft, which would put the gauge 300 to 400 m N or NW. The 1870s record has two separate observers with seaparate record  sheets, which may mean the gauge location is different. The two 1870s sheets have been combined in this record as they do not overlap
The 1895 readings are noted as being up to 12 inches low. The annaul total has an increased figure pencilled in. This record keeps the orignal monthly readings and the associated total
